original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs85bn in bonds, yields edge lower
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields fell across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with the entire offer including 12 months bill securities being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
45 billion rupees of 3 months bills were sold at 29.59 percent, down 13 basis points.
20 billion rupees of 6 month bills were sold at 28.64 percent, down 3 basis points.
20 billion rupees of 12 month bills were sold at 27.64 percent down 03 basis points.
A post – auction offer is available in all maturities. (Colombo/Mar01/2023)
